title: US press freedom under scrutiny after arrest of two journalists during Minneapolis protests
subhead: The arrests of Don Lemon, on Thursday evening in Los Angeles, who was released the following day, and reporter Georgia Fort marked another milestone in the American government's political use of the justice system.

title: US envoy reports 'constructive' Ukraine talks with Russia
French IT giant Capgemini to sell US subsidiary after row over ICE links
Over 300 people thought missing in Mediterranean as shipwrecks continue
subhead: In mid-January, eight vessels that had departed Tunisia were reported in distress. As many as 380 people were on board these boats, according to one radio station. All are now considered missing.

title: Israel to end Doctors Without Borders work in Gaza
subhead: Israel said Sunday it would end the work of Doctors Without Borders in Gaza after it failed to provide a list of its Palestinian staff.

title: Syria's government reaches agreement with Kurds of Rojava
subhead: A ceasefire has been established after three weeks of fighting. The Kurds have secured major gains in local autonomy and national rights, while the Syrian president claims to have restored national unity.

title: In Italy, the 'forest family' becomes a blessing for the far right
subhead: Many have rallied behind a couple living in seclusion in a forest, whose children were taken into care by the courts. Matteo Salvini's Lega party has unleashed harsh criticism against the judges.

title: General Philippe Morillon, former UN commander during the Bosnian War, dies at 90

Catherine O'Hara, iconic comedy figure, dies age 71
Venezuela's interim president announces mass amnesty law
US Senate passes deal expected to shorten shutdown

US Justice Department releases over 3 million more pages of Epstein files
In Svalbard, where sea ice is vanishing faster than anywhere else, polar bears remain healthy
subhead: The bears have not lost weight over the past 20 years in the Norwegian archipelago, despite the region's accelerating warming. Among the reasons: They hunt prey other than seals, such as reindeer and birds.

title: 'The only thing left to do is leave': Cuba pushed to the brink
subhead: 'Cuba, an island adrift' (2/3). Since the wave of unrest that swept the country in 2021, more than two million Cubans have fled. Those who remain on the island scrape by with varying degrees of success, as the exorbitant price of basic goods has become a source of inequality between those with nothing and those with access to foreign currency.

title: 'Facing Trump, Europe, Canada and Latin America have to navigate between misalignment, non-alignment and avoidance'
subhead: The sweeping powers that the US president has granted himself through his Board of Peace serve only to discourage even the best intentions, observes Le Monde's columnist Gilles Paris.

title: Environment: Europe's temptation to unravel hard-won progress, ignoring scientific truth
The duty of solidarity with the Iranian people
Thomas Piketty: 'European countries have achieved unprecedented levels of prosperity and social well-being'
